pr_title: JEP371 ClassData Support and JEP383 Support (Part 3)

timeline.bodyText: This duplicates the body of defineClass.  Can the Class<?> defineClass(boolean initOption) version forward to this one with a null classData?
timeline.author: DanHeidinga

replies.bodyText: Yes. Addressed in the HEAD commit.
replies.author: babsingh

timeline.bodyText: class data bytes may be confusing given the addition of the classData object
timeline.author: DanHeidinga

replies.bodyText: Reworded class data bytes to class file bytes in the HEAD commit.
replies.author: babsingh

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            		 * Constructs a new hidden class from an array of class data bytes.
          
          
            
            		 * Constructs a new hidden class from an array of class file bytes.
timeline.author: DanHeidinga

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            		 * @param bytes the class data bytes of the hidden class to be defined.
          
          
            
            		 * @param bytes the class file bytes of the hidden class to be defined.
timeline.author: DanHeidinga
DanHeidinga

replies.bodyText: RI introduced MethodHandles.classData with an unused String. We had to match the RI in order to support calls from the JEP383 API.
replies.author: babsingh

timeline.bodyText: Is this field visible to Reflection in the RI?
timeline.author: DanHeidinga

replies.bodyText: The Class.classData field is listed in Reflection.fieldFilterMap. It gets filtered out from public-view. I don't think it is visible to Reflection in the RI. Assuming, I have correctly read the code.
replies.author: babsingh

timeline.bodyText: How did we determine that true aka initialize is the right value here?
timeline.author: DanHeidinga

replies.bodyText: From the documentation. defineHiddenClassWithClassData is a package private method so its documentation does not get published in the official docs.
replies.author: babsingh

timeline.message:
Update comments and modified ClassDefiner.defineClass as per code-review

Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>

Update comments and modify ClassDefiner.defineClass as per code-review

Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>

JEP371 ClassData Support and JEP383 Support (Part 3)

JEP371 ClassData Support:

1. Implement Class.setClassData(...) and Class.getClassData()
2. Store classData in Access.defineClass(...)
3. Implement Access.classData(...)
4. Implement MethodHandleNatives.classData(...)
5. Implement ClassDefiner.defineClass(initOption, classData)
6. Implement Lookup.defineHiddenClassWithClassData(...)
7. Implement MethodHandles.classData(...)

JEP383 Support (Part 3):

1. Implement MethodHandles.permuteArgumentChecks(...)
2. Implement MethodHandles.collectReturnValue(...)
3. Implement VarHandle.target()
4. Implement VarHandle.asDirect()
5. Implement VarHandle.isDirect()
6. Implement VarHandle.getMethodHandle(...)

Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>

Set Class.classData before init in ClassLoader_defineClassImpl1

Before the new JEP371 changes, the classData could be set in
Access.defineClass in Java code before the class was initialized.

With the new JEP371 changes, all code to define and init the class was
moved into native code, ClassLoader_defineClassImpl1.

This requires Class.classData to be initialized within
ClassLoader_defineClassImpl1 before the class is initialized.

Class.setClassData is removed since it is no longer used.

Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>

Update comments and modify ClassDefiner.defineClass as per code-review

Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>

Update comments and modify ClassDefiner.defineClass as per code-review

Signed-off-by: Babneet Singh <sbabneet@ca.ibm.com>
